TopicTitle: 101+ reasons why we are not NASA

Articles.Content:
457) No competition for the taxpayer's dollars

458) All of the taxpayer's dollars anyway

459) we fly to the mun as the frist mission of the history

460) we use (maybe) ponies as mascots

461) we use parts that were found on the side of the road

462) we hire hightly stupid pilot

463) we are controled by an alien being

464) (Jeb was supposed to do this one)

465) we are the only facility still operating on kerbin

466) we have a place-holder command center

467) all these button are painted on the cokpit

468) we do long post on a meanless forum

(did I break a record?)

Also :

411. Apart from KSC, our temperate planet with ample oceans and expansive green fields is devoid of animal and plant life, cities, roads and infrastructure.

There's tree, an overload of tree! (and grass, which is plant lifeform)

Edited October 22, 2013 by mrrpamplemousse

468 our Men have skulls of because you can land them on there heads and they survive

489 we can GO interstellar when we want

470 we have infinite food and water

471 our crew freakout to much

471 we may go to Jool without YEARS of calculating

Edited October 22, 2013 by Dooz
472: We design rockets that have no chance of doing what they are supposed to do, but we launch them anyway.
473) we do hundred of prototype that have no real use

474) We measure astronaut's competency by their combined courage and stupidity

475) We hire astronauts based on "Can you fit into the capsule?" alone
476. We have a Congress; They don't

If big space agencies like NASA planned missions the way we do, built rockets the way we do and/or did anything the way we do in this game, countless things would go wrong (unless they hired Scott Manley)

Lets start a list of 101 (+?) reasons why we are not NASA:

I'll start

1 - We build manned ICBM's

2 - We strand kerbals on other planets

3 - We crash kerbals into the sun

4 - We try to land on gas giants

Please continue... (I'd like to see some funny ones)

Ummmmm... sorry to say this....

The early manned rockets that NASA used *were* actually ICBM's...

I mean, sorry, but just sayin... y'know.

477 Unlike real life, our Astro-nuts keep coming back to life...

488 When an astronaut dies, we are sad, when a Kerbal dies, we dance for joy and laugh our heads off....

Edited October 23, 2013 by kiwi1960

489: We turn out rockets like sausages. That is to say, instantly.

490: Every rocket has a built-in time machine.

491: Flying by autopilot is frowned upon.

492: A 50% failure rate is perfectly acceptable.

493: If your rocket crashes on the pad, it's very likely your astronauts are okay.

494: We don't have to add life support.
495: Even if the kerbal is stupid or coraguous, we put em on rockets.

496) A Kerb's death is OK as long as they went out spectacularly.

497) Science is measured in units of science.

498) At least, science involving mystery dumpster goo and glowing squid.

499) Kerbs laugh in the face of certain death, die, and then come back to life to repeat the process.

*and finally*

500) We're dedicated enough to point out five hundred differences between us and real life
501: we use astronauts as projectiles to blow holes through deep space outposts
502. We deorbit our astronauts to try and land them on their heads.
503: we destroy planets with long-girder craft
504: whenever we run out of fuel we have our astronauts get out and push
505) We laugh at Kerbal's deaths like its no biggie, there's more where that came from.
506) Kerbal are disposable, like our rockets

502. We deorbit our astronauts to try and land them on their heads.

Turns out, landing nearly flat but slightly headfirst is actually one of the safer ways to hit sans-chute.

408. When NASA's rockets explode, they abandon the design. When our rockets explode, we add MOAR BOOSTERZ!

No, look at the space shuttle? 2/5 exploded... They not only used them after the first, but also the second 100% fatal catastrophic failure.
507 - landing a spaceplane on the moon at orbital speed to save fuel sounds like a good idea to us (dodging crater rims is scary, I know from experience).
508 - landed too hard? STRUCTURAL PYLONS!!!
509 - we design ships that blow themselves up in orbit to spread 2000 rcs thrusters around, just to see what would happen.

510 - the above ships are manned with no return capability after detonation.

511 - we leave our kerbals outside the capsules on physics warp to see if they get hit by something.

Edited November 6, 2013 by Pds314
512- there is no consequence for hurting a kerbal, like spinal injuries, broken limbs, trauma...
513 - we launch manned ships in retrograde orbits to try and hit debris.
